meanings.definition: To exceed the capacity of a space by having too many people or things.
meanings.sent1: The small room was outcrowded with guests during the party.
meanings.sent2: The bus was outcrowded with passengers during rush hour.
meanings.sent3: The picnic basket was outcrowded with delicious treats for everyone to enjoy.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt outcrowded with love for her newborn baby.
meanings.sent5: The library shelves were outcrowded with books of all genres.

meanings.definition: Having too many people or things in a space.
meanings.sent1: The outcrowded elevator struggled to fit all the people inside.
meanings.sent2: The outcrowded classroom made it hard for students to find seats.
meanings.sent3: The outcrowded closet burst open with clothes falling out.
meanings.sent4: The outcrowded schedule left no time for relaxation.
meanings.sent5: The outcrowded beach was bustling with families enjoying the sun.
